sentences.en: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.cn: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

sentences.en: And regulators concede that large positions held by banks can be benign.
sentences.cn: 而且,监管者承认,银行拥有的大量头寸(position)非常有益.

sentences.en: He refused to concede an inch.
He was willing to concede everything.
He will not concede what anything ails his business.
sentences.cn: 他不允许任何事情来干扰他的工作.

sentences.en: I concede that point, but I still think you are wrong generally.
sentences.cn: 我承认那一点, 不过我认为总的说来你是错的.

sentences.en: I concede that you are right.
I'll concede you are not as bigoted as some.
sentences.cn: 我承认你不象有些人那么顽固.

sentences.en: In 1638 he had to concede the abolition of the court.
sentences.cn: 1638年他被迫认可该法院的废除.

sentences.en: In fact, why should we concede them at all?
sentences.cn: 实际上, 我们为什么要让步 呢 ?

sentences.en: It's certainly big, I'll concede you that.
sentences.cn: 那确实很大, 在这一点上我向你认输.

sentences.en: Knew to refuse to concede defeat of struggle spirit.
sentences.cn: 懂得了不服输的奋斗精神.

sentences.en: The Georgian forces defended the capital but were finally obliged to concede.
sentences.cn: 格鲁吉亚军队奋起保卫首都，但最终被迫投降。
参议员只好承认竞选失败.

sentences.en: We cannot concede any of our territory , ie allow another country to have it.
sentences.cn: 我们寸土不让(不让他国得到).

sentences.en: We cannot concede any of our territory.
sentences.cn: 我们决不能放弃1寸国土.

sentences.en: You concede nothing to me and I have to concede everything to you.
sentences.cn: 你对我无论什么都不肯让步;我对你,可无论什么都得让步.

trans.tran_cn: 承认，让步，认输，授予（权利、特权）
trans.tran_en: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true
to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

trans.tran_cn: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
trans.tran_en: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true
